newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Eravis, Pannon buy Hunguest stakes.
newsitem.headline: Eravis, Pannon buy Hunguest stakes.

text.p: Hungarian hotelier Eravis Rt, the holding company Pannon-Valto Rt and Aquincum Rt acquired a total 50 percent stake in the hotel chain Hunguest Rt, Eravis said on Saturday in the official gazette of the Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE).
The consortium was led by Eravis, which acquired 32.8 percent of Hunguest, Eravis said, adding that Pannon-Valto got 10.4 percent and Aquincum 6.8 percent.
Eravis did not disclose further details of the deal.

Eravis was suspended on the BSE for Friday because Hungarian newspapers had published contradictory reports about the acquisition and Eravis had not made official information about the transaction available to investors.
Eravis closed at 4,300 forints on the BSE on Thursday.
Pannon-Valto closed at 580 forints on Thursday, when it was last traded on the BSE.
